arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Musiala leads FCB "reaction", Frankfurt draw, Bayer extend winning streak
arts.sum: German record champions FC Bayern München have opened up a six-point-gap at the top of the Bundesliga table after they won their Saturday 15:30 kickoff while second-place Eintracht Frankfurt drew theirs. Elsewhere, defending champs Leverkusen made it five straight wins on-the-bounce while bottom dwellers Bochum and Kiel both lost.

arts.ttl: Jonathan Tah says midfielder Liverpool let go was just as skilful as Ronaldinho
arts.sum: Liverpool have had some incredibly skilful players in recent years. Luis Diaz has been hailed as the most skilful player at Liverpool in recent times,...

arts.ttl: Barcelona’s first signing of 2025/26: Blaugrana close to securing superstar free agent
arts.sum: Out of contract in 2025, Real Madrid and Manchester United have since taken an interest in landing the 28-year-old on a free transfer, but Romano says that Barcelona are clear favourites to secure his signature. Barcelona are close to securing their first new face for the 2025/26 campaign, with Fabrizio Romano announcing that Hansi Flick’s side are nearing a deal to add Jonathan Tah to their ranks.

arts.ttl: Mkhitaryan discloses his secret and warns Inter on ‘changed’ Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Mkhitaryan won the Man of the Match award during Inter’s 3-1 home win over Parma,...

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen predicted XI v St. Pauli: An attacking selection dilemma for Xabi Alonso
arts.sum: Xabi Alonso will be without Patrik Schick and Victor Boniface when they host St. Pauli at the BayArena in the Bundesliga on Saturday afternoon. Schick has scored six goals in…

arts.ttl: Liverpool 'in constant talks' to sign £9.4m Xabi Alonso favourite as three-club transfer battle emerges
arts.sum: Liverpool are in constant dialogue over a deal to sign Bayer Leverkusen wing-back Jeremie Frimpong, according to a report.

arts.ttl: St. Pauli's Oladapo Afolayan on life in the Bundesliga, being friends with Michael Olise and his World Cup dream
arts.sum: "I can't be thankful enough to the club and the staff who brought me here to give me the opportunity to play in front of a wonderful set of fans," beamed the man who was involved in all three goals as Pauli secured a first Bundesliga home win in 13 years, 3-1 over Kiel on Matchday 12 . In an exclusive interview with bundesliga.com, the Englishman sat down to discuss his love for Pauli and Hamburg, his atypical career path, the quality of Germany's top flight, kickabouts with Bayern's Michael Olise and more...

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen’s selection dilemma: Patrik Schick and Victor Boniface injured
arts.sum: Xabi Alonso faces a selection dilemma in attack when his Bayer Leverkusen side host St. Pauli in the Bundesliga on Saturday afternoon. The Spaniard confirmed that Die Werkself are without…

arts.ttl: Five goalscorers to watch out for this weekend: Piroe to strike against Rams
arts.sum: Mo Salah to find the net in the Merseyside derby will be a popular bet this weekend given the Egyptian's scoring streak but Steve Davies has five other potential goalscorers to look out for.

arts.ttl: Leverkusen vs. St. Pauli preview: Defending champs hope to keep up momentum without Schick
arts.sum: Xabi Alonso's Bayer 04 Leverkusen - having found their stride recently - hope to make it five straight wins on-the-trot in their first meeting with FC St. Pauli since 2011. The defending league and cup champs have actually struggled against bottom-table sides this season and will be missing lead-striker Patrik Schick.
